gurmukhi: iqn ky gUV m`q jy clhI ]BwNiq Anyk duKn so dlhI ]20]
transliteration: Tin Ke Good Matt Je Chal-hoo|| Bhaant(i) Anek Doukhan So Dal-hoo||20||
translation: Whosoever follows their path, he crushes various types of sufferings.20.

gurmukhi: jy jy sihq jwqn sMdyih ]pRB ko sMig n Cofq nyh ]
transliteration: Je Je Sahit Jaatan Sandeh(i)|| Prabh Ko San(i) Na Chhodhat Neh||
translation: Those who consider the castes illusory, they do not abandon the love of the Lord.

gurmukhi: qy qy prm purI kh jwhI ]iqn hir isau AMqru kCu nwhIN ]21]
transliteration: Te Te Param Puroo Kah Jaahoo|| Tin Har(i) Sio Antar(u) Kachh(u) Naahoon||21||
translation: When they leave the world, they go to the abode of the Lord, and there is no difference between them and the Lord.21.

gurmukhi: jy jy jIX jwqn qy frY ]prm pRK qij iqn mg prY ]
transliteration: Je Je Jooya Jaatan Te Darai|| Param Purakh Taj(i) Tin Mag Darai||
translation: Those who fear the castes and follow their path, abandoning the Supreme Lord.

gurmukhi: qy qy nrk kuMf mo prhI ]bwr bwr jg mo bpu DrhI ]22]
transliteration: Te Te Narak Kound Mo Par-hoo|| Baar Baar Jag Mo Bap(u) Dhar-hoo||22||
translation: They fall into hell and transmigrate again and again.22.

gurmukhi: qb hir bhur d`q aupjwieE ]iqn BI Apnw pMQu clwieE ]
transliteration: Tab Har(i) Bahur Datt Oupjaaio|| Tin Bhoo Apnaa Panth(u) Chalaaio||
translation: Then I created Dutt, who also started his own path.

gurmukhi: kr mo nK isr jtwN svwrI ]pRB kI kiRAw n kCU ibcwrI ]23]
transliteration: Kar Mo Nakh Sir Jataan Savaroo|| Prabh Koo Kriaa Na Kachhodh Bichdaroo||23||
translation: His followed have long nail in their hands and matted hair on their heads . They did not understand the ways of the Lord.23

gurmukhi: puin hir gorK kO auprwjw ]is`K kry iqnhUM bf rwjw ]
transliteration: Poun(i) Har(i) Gorakh Kau Oupraajaa|| Sikkh Dare Tinhoon Bad Raajaa||
translation: Then I ccreated Gorakh, who made great kings his disciples.

gurmukhi: s√çn Pwir mudRw duAY fwrI ]hir kI pRIq rIiq n ibcwrI ]24]
transliteration: Sravan Pdaar(i) Mudraa Duai Ddaroo|| Har(i) Koo Proot Root(i) Na Bichdaroo||24||
translation: His disciples wear rings in their ears and do not know the love of the lord.24.

gurmukhi: puin hir rwmwnMd ko krw ]Bys bYrwgI ko ijn Drw ]
transliteration: Poun(i) Har(i) Raamaanand Do Karaa|| Bhes Bairaagoo Ko Jin Dharaa||
translation: Then I created Ramanand, who adopted the path of Bairagi.

gurmukhi: kMTI kMiT kwT kI fwrI ]pRB kI kiRAw n kCU ibcwrI ]25]
transliteration: Kanthoo Kanth(i) Kaadh Koo Ddaroo|| Prabh Koo Kriaa Na Kachhodh Bichdaroo||25||
translation: Around his neck he wore necklace of wooden beads and did not comprehend the ways of the Lord.25.

gurmukhi: jy pRBu prm purK aupjwey ]iqn iqn Apny rwh clwey ]
transliteration: Je Prabh(u) Param Purakh Oupjaae|| Tin Tin Apne Raah Chadhaae||
translation: All the great Purushas created by me started their own paths.

gurmukhi: mhwdIn qb pRB auprwjw ]Arb dys ko kIno rwjw ]26]
transliteration: Mahaadoon Tab Prabh Oupraajaa|| Arab Des Ko Koono Raajaa||26||
translation: Then I created Muhammed, who was made the master of Arabia.26.

gurmukhi: iqn BI eyk pMQ auprwjw ]ilMg ibnw kIny sB rwjw ]
transliteration: Tin Bhoo Ei Panth Oupraajaa|| Ling Binaa Koone Sabh Raajaa||
translation: He started a religion and circumcised all the kings.
